member.name: T:EventTracing.ClockResolution
member.summary: The clock resolution used during tracing.

member.name: F:EventTracing.ClockResolution.QueryPerformanceCounter
member.summary: Query performance counter (QPC). The QPC counter provides a high-resolution time stamp that is not affected by adjustments to the system clock.

member.name: F:EventTracing.ClockResolution.SystemTime
member.summary: System time. The system time provides a time stamp that tracks changes to the systemâ€™s clock.

member.name: F:EventTracing.ClockResolution.CpuCycleCounter
member.summary: CPU cycle counter. The CPU counter provides the highest resolution time stamp and is the least resource-intensive to retrieve. However, the CPU counter is unreliable and should not be used in production.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.ClockResolution
member.summary: The clock resolution used by the session.

member.name: M:EventTracing.EtwSession.GetAllSessions
member.summary: Gets all ETW sessions the user has access to.

member.name: M:EventTracing.EtwSession.GetSession(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the session with the given name.
member.returns: The session, if found, null otherwise.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.BufferSize
member.summary: Amount of memory allocated for each event tracing session buffer, in kilobytes.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.MinimumBuffers
member.summary: Minimum number of buffers allocated for the event tracing session's buffer pool.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.MaximumBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of buffers allocated for the event tracing session's buffer pool.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.MaximumFileSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the file used to log events, in megabytes.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.LogFileMode
member.summary: Logging modes for the event tracing session.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.FlushTimer
member.summary: How often, in seconds, the trace buffers are forcibly flushed.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.SystemTraceProvidersEnabled
member.summary: Which kernel events should be included in the trace.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Properties.LogFileName
member.summary: The name of the log file.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Statistics.NumberOfBuffers
member.summary: The number of buffers allocated for the event tracing session's buffer pool.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Statistics.FreeBuffers
member.summary: The number of buffers that are allocated but unused in the event tracing session's buffer pool.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Statistics.EventsLost
member.summary: The number of events that were not recorded.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Statistics.LogBuffersLost
member.summary: The number of buffers that could not be written to the log file.

member.name: P:EventTracing.EtwSession.Statistics.RealTimeBuffersLost
member.summary: The number of buffers that could not be delivered in real-time to the consumer.

member.name: T:EventTracing.LogFileMode
member.summary: Flags for how events are logged.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.FileModeSequential
member.summary: Writes events to a log file sequentially; stops when the file reaches its maximum size.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.FileModeCircular
member.summary: Writes events to a log file. After the file reaches the maximum size, the oldest events are replaced with incoming events.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.FileModeAppend
member.summary: Appends events to an existing sequential log file. If the file does not exist, it is created.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.FileModeNewFile
member.summary: Automatically switches to a new log file when the file reaches the maximum size.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.FileModePreAllocate
member.summary: Reserves the maximum file size of disk space for the log file in advance.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.NonStoppableMode
member.summary: The logging session cannot be stopped.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.SecureMode
member.summary: Restricts who can log events to the session.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.RealTimeMode
member.summary: Delivers the events to consumers in real-time. Events are delivered when the buffers are flushed, not at the time the provider writes the event.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.DelayOpenFileMode
member.summary: Delay opening the log file until an event occurs.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.BufferingMode
member.summary: This mode writes events to a circular memory buffer. Events written beyond the total size of the buffer evict the oldest events still remaining in the buffer.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.PrivateLoggerMode
member.summary: Creates a user-mode event tracing session that runs in the same process as its event trace provider.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.AddHeaderMode
member.summary: Adds a header to the log file.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.UseKbytesForSize
member.summary: Use kilobytes as the unit of measure for specifying the size of a file. The default unit of measure is megabytes.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.UseGlobalSequence
member.summary: Uses sequence numbers that are unique across event tracing sessions.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.UseLocalSequence
member.summary: Uses sequence numbers that are unique only for an individual event tracing session.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.PrivateInProc
member.summary: Enforces that only the process that registered the provider GUID can start the logger session with that GUID.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.ModeReserved
member.summary: Signal heap and critical section tracing.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.IndependentSessionMode
member.summary: A logging session should not be affected by EventWrite failures in other sessions.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.NoPerProcessorBuffering
member.summary: Writes events that were logged on different processors to a common buffer.

member.name: F:EventTracing.LogFileMode.AddToTriageDump
member.summary: Adds ETW buffers to triage dumps.

member.name: F:EventTracing.SystemTraceProvider.NoSysConfig
member.summary: Do not do system configuration rundown.
